image.altText: A man and woman hand in hand outside of a courthouse, walking away from it.

props.synopsis: Celebrity crocodile wrangler Matt Wright has been sentenced to 10 months in prison, suspended after five months, for attempting to interfere with an investigation into a fatal helicopter accident three years ago.

title.children: Celebrity croc wrangler Matt Wright sentenced to time in prison

image.altText: Man in white shirt and black tie walking

props.synopsis: Gavin Morris, the former principal of Yipirinya School in Alice Springs, has received an 18-month suspended sentence for the aggravated assault of four students.

title.children: Ex-Alice Springs principal handed suspended sentence for assaulting students

image.altText: A supermarket fresh food aisle.

props.synopsis: A wholesaler hopes a review of a controversial outback food subsidy scheme will be independent and transparent.

title.children: Independent wholesaler cautiously welcomes food subsidy scheme review

image.altText: A gas exploration site in outback scrubland.

props.synopsis: Major global oil and gas companies are expressing "serious interest" in the Beetaloo Basin for the first time, one analyst says, now that Beetaloo Energy has reached a final investment decision and committed to developing its fracking project.

title.children: Gas company clears final hurdle for fracking in the Beetaloo Basin

image.altText: A young man wearing a blue shirt and sunglasses outside the local court.

props.synopsis: The NT Court of Criminal Appeal has heard an appeal against the sentence for a 24-year-old driver who avoided a jail sentence after hitting two Aboriginal pedestrians with his vehicle, killing one, and then boasting about it over text.

title.children: 'Vile' and 'repugnant' texts sent by fatal hit-run driver at centre of appeal

image.altText: Tiwi person with traditional paint on face dances with hands up during ceremony

props.synopsis: The agreement with the federal government sees the Tiwi Islands included in Australia's national parks and reserves system.

title.children: Tiwi Islands become 700,000-hectare Indigenous Protected Area

image.altText: A street in a town with a clock tower that has a temperature sign reading 32 degrees Celsius.

props.synopsis: A business owner has called for a youth curfew in Tennant Creek, after a weekend crime spree involving the theft of multiple cars, rams raids and a police chase through the Northern Territory town.

title.children: Tennant Creek business wants youth curfew but NT police 'not considering it'

image.altText: A picture of two septic tanks with lids off in a remote community backyard.

props.synopsis: Aboriginal housing advocates are calling for urgent improvements to the way remote public housing is maintained in the Northern Territory, after the coroner found the death of a toddler who fell into a backyard septic tank could have been prevented.

title.children: Calls for government action after toddler's septic tank death

image.altText: A red X on a map of Japan shows the location of an earthquake off its northeast coast

props.synopsis: The quake struck off Japan's north-east coast with a depth of 20 kilometres, after a bigger, 7.5-magnitude earthquake hit the same region late on Monday.

title.children: Tsunami warning for northern Japan called off after magnitude 6.9 earthquake

image.altText: close up of Bulgarian Prime Minister Rosen Zhelyazkov

props.synopsis: Bulgaria's prime minister announced the decision in a televised address saying "ahead of today's vote of no confidence, the government is resigning".

title.children: Bulgaria faces turmoil after anti-corruption protests topple government

image.altText: A screengrab of a message from Instagram with Ms Cronk's profile, telling her her account had been disabled.

props.synopsis: A mother of three is urgently trying to regain access to her social media business accounts after being locked out during the blanket under-16s social media ban.

title.children: 30yo mother can't access social accounts after being caught in under-16s ban

image.altText: Anthony Albanese points, with Anika Wells behind him.

props.synopsis: Sports and Communications Minister Anika Wells referred her claims to the Independent Parliamentary Expenses Authority for review after a stream of questions over her spending earlier this week.

title.children: PM says he has asked independent watchdog for advice on politician perks

image.altText: Tyler Robinson in a court room with a neutral expression.

props.synopsis: Lawyers for Tyler Robinson, the man accused of killing conservative activist Charlie Kirk, have sought to limit media access to ensure a fair trial.

title.children: Suspect in Charlie Kirk killing makes first in-court appearance

image.altText: A orange tent on sand with meteors in the background.

props.synopsis: You'll need to get up early, but the views could be worth it to catch the best glimpse of the Geminids meteor shower this weekend.

title.children: How to see Australia's best meteor shower this weekend

image.altText: The exterior of a white casino building with shrapnel holes and burn marks.

props.synopsis: An expert says the Thai military's strikes on Cambodian casinos and suspected scam centres could be putting the lives of civilians and human trafficking victims at risk and may be considered war crimes.

title.children: Thailand bombs Cambodian casinos and scam centres

image.altText: The exterior of an ANZ Bank branch.

props.synopsis: Former ANZ chief executive Shayne Elliott is suing the bank for stripping him of $13.5 million in bonuses. Local stocks rallied on Friday after the Dow hit new records in a mixed session for Wall Street overnight.

title.children: Former ANZ boss sues bank over $13.5 million in lost bonuses — as it happened

image.altText: A picture of a boy and his grandmother smiling

props.synopsis: The lawsuit is one of a growing number of wrongful death legal actions against AI chatbot makers across the country.

title.children: OpenAI sued for allegedly enabling murder-suicide in US

image.altText: Dozens of police officers, protesters, and media on the steps of the convention centre surrounded by pepper spray.

props.synopsis: A Supreme Court judge awards $54,000 in damages to a protester who sued Victoria Police after officers used pepper spray at a protest in 2019 outside the Melbourne Exhibition Centre.

title.children: 'Cruel and degrading': Protester wins pepper-spray case against police

image.altText: A massive wave bursts into the air.

props.synopsis: A natural phenomenon leaves surfers in awe of the "earthquake" wave.

title.children: 'Magic wave' found off WA coast after surfer's decade-long search

image.altText: A baked ham leg glazed with maple syrup and spices, a simple recipe for Christmas.

props.synopsis: Christmas is around the corner and we have plenty of delicious ideas whether you're hosting or bringing dessert.

title.children: Plan Christmas with our 10 essential recipes

image.altText: Close up of elderly person's hand on a chair.

props.synopsis: Elder abuse often occurs within families, with a parliamentary inquiry describing the issue as part of a wider systemic problem.

title.children: Elder abuse 'under-reported' but no need for new laws, parliamentary inquiry says

image.altText: A man in a suit, seen from close up, looking on with a serious expression on his face.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump says the US will soon strike drug shipments making their way from Venezuela on land, amid a large-scale military build-up in the southern Caribbean to increase pressure on Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro.

title.children: Trump again says land strikes on Venezuela drug shipments coming soon

image.altText: A US military helicopter appearing blue in a video screenshot with an abseil line hanging out a side-door over a boat

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's assertions on foreign policy since his return to the White House have literally stretched from one end of the Western Hemisphere to the other.

title.children: Trump's oil tanker seizure raises questions about potential Venezuela blockade

image.altText: Nemo stands on  stage after winning the trophy in 2024

props.synopsis: Swiss singer Nemo says they will return the trophy they won in 2024 over the EBU's decision to let Israel participate in 2026.

title.children: 2024 Eurovision winner returns trophy over Israel's participation

image.altText: A man wearing a grey suit jacket and white shirt looks on with a serious expression, as he holds his chin

props.synopsis: Carl Erik Rinsch is convicted on charges that he scammed Netflix out of $US11 million for a show that never materialised, instead using the cash for purchases including luxury cars and homewares.

title.children: Hollywood director convicted of scamming $16.5m from Netflix

image.altText: Man in suit shaking hands with man in fluro work wear.

props.synopsis: A deal is being finalised between Tomago Aluminium and the state and federal governments to keep the smelter open beyond 2028.

title.children: Long-term power deal being finalised to keep aluminium smelter open

image.altText: A dark-haired man in sunglasses wears dark clothing as he walks along a street.

props.synopsis: Suspended NSW police officer Tylar Shepheard, charged with possessing child abuse material among other charges, has had strict conditions placed on him.

title.children: NSW police officer faces court over child abuse material charges

image.altText: A police car outside National Zoo and Aquarium.

props.synopsis: Jude Wijesinghe is sentenced to 30 years' jail for stabbing his Canberra zoo colleague Tshewang Choden to death in the storeroom of the kitchen area where they both worked.

title.children: Man jailed for murdering co-worker 'because he couldn't have her'

image.altText: A man and a boy on a boat.

props.synopsis: Students and teachers of St Helens District High School defy the Stieglitz bushfire to rescue formal wear, assemble decorations and food and hold their year 10 formal.

title.children: Bushfire-affected student ferried to school formal in boat

image.altText: Jim Chalmers walks down a hallway wearing a suit and red tie.

props.synopsis: Jim Chalmers said there will be "strict conditions" on the South Korean defence conglomerate's stake in the strategic shipbuilder, in a nod to the diplomatic and security sensitivities surrounding the bid.

title.children: Treasurer approves Hanwha's double stake in Australian shipbuilder

image.altText: Dicky Bill sign with photo of the family that runs the business

props.synopsis: Administrators for failed Australian salad farm company Dicky Bill reveal its business debts to hundreds of staff and suppliers could exceed $10 million.

title.children: Dicky Bill salad farm's $10m debt shock as creditors try to claw back millions

image.altText: Screenshots of advertisements on Chinese social media promoting illegal immigration to Australia

props.synopsis: Recent boat arrivals in Western Australia offer a glimpse into how routes through South-East Asia, particularly Indonesia, are being used to reach Australia.

title.children: As US borders tighten, Australia becomes the new target for desperate Chinese migrants

image.altText: Profile of a man,

props.synopsis: Prosecutors in Greg Lynn's Victorian High Country murder trial are preparing for a second trial after the Court of Appeal quashed his conviction.

title.children: Greg Lynn successfully appealed his murder conviction. What happens now?

image.altText: A group of tech CEOs sit on a metal construction beam, a throwback to a famous photograph of workers on a skyscraper.

props.synopsis: The magazine cites the tremendous technological advances made by the artificial intelligence industry over the past year in bringing on the age of "thinking machines".

title.children: TIME magazine names 'The Architects of AI' as Person of the Year
